data.title: The Absolute at Large (Továrna na absolutno in the original Czech, literally translated as The Factory for the Absolute), is a science...
data.meta_description:
9 likes, 0 comments - armadillospillow on June 15, 2024: "The Absolute at Large (Továrna na absolutno in the original Czech, literally translated as The Factory for the Absolute), is a science fiction novel written by Czech author Karel Čapek in 1922.

It was Čapek's science fiction play R.U.R. that introduced the word robot to the English language.
This story explores ideas about the imperfection of perfection.

This is a U.S., Macmillan, First Edition, 1927.

$25.00

Can we declare that there are absolutely no absolutes?

Perhaps there are several.".
